availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James T. Chambers (Caldwell co., ky, farmer )

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Marry to Alsey Chambers. Father of William T. Chambers, Sarah Chambers, Permelia A. Chambers, Mary Chambers, Thomas P. Chambers, J. F. Chambers, and R. L. Chambers. Farmer in Princeton, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 31.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 507A.
"James T. Chambers (1823-1882)," Find A Grave, Memorial #25947881, accessed April 6, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/25947881.
